question:
It is better to save money than to spend it.How far do you agree with this statement? Is saving more important than spending in
today’s world?Give reasons for your answer, and provide ideas and examples from your ownexperience.
text: In today's world, a large number of persons may be vulnerable to financial problems that occur on a daily basis. As a result, it is believed that saving a large amount of money is better than spend it. Saving money appears to me to have numerous advantages in our lives and in this essay, I will show why this is such an important issue.

On the one hand, storing money is a critical goal for preparing for unexpected events in the future. It is an irrefutable fact that various hazards may occur in our lives that we were previously unable to forecast. Simultaneously, the property is almost addressing the risk, for example, how unpleasant it is that health problems strike us unexpectedly and without warning. From this point forward, certain funds in reserve will be used for treatment scenarios. Second, practically every citizen will make plans to buy a home or a car, even for their children. All of our plans are geared around settling down in our lives. As a result, they must work hard while not overspending in order to carry out their plan quickly.

Saving money unnecessarily, on the other hand, is not always a good idea. It is because it is easier to live in the moment and spend money on hobbies or things that we desire. It has the potential to assist us in reducing mental health problems such as stress and anxiety. It also helps us to be happy at that time.
In my opinion, saving money is a more important act which is the best option for improving our lives. It also makes it easier for us to deal with the challenges we face these days.
